events.message: I have just filed a claim for my car after a collision that happened near the intersection. The accident caused significant damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim has been categorised under the Auto Accident cluster as the damage clearly involves my vehicle's collision with another car.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims has been assigned to handle my case and will be contacting me shortly.
I received confirmation from the insurance company acknowledging my claim and assuring me they will start processing it as soon as possible.
The insurance agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report from the collision, and a copy of the driver's license for verification.
I submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the car damage, the official police accident report, and my identification.
The insurance company has started the investigation into the accident to verify the collision details and assess the claim validity.
The investigation was completed and it confirmed that the accident was due to a third-party fault, and the damages are covered under my policy.
The insurer proposed a settlement covering the repair costs for the vehicle damage, minus my deductible as specified in the insurance contract.
I provided positive feedback on the prompt handling of my claim and clear communication through every stage of the process.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department following all validations and approvals on the settlement terms.
The payment for the approved settlement amount was issued directly to the repair shop to cover the car repairs.
After full payment and confirmation that repairs were complete, the claim was officially closed by the insurance company.
All documents and communications related to the claim were archived for record-keeping and future reference if needed.
